name: Quick Seafood Pasta with Shrimp in Pink Cream Sauce
author: nch
summary: This is a quick and easy seafood pasta recipe with shrimp in a cream sauce. I came up with it the other day when I had unexpected dinner guests and only had some frozen shrimp in the freezer. It came out so good that it is now one of my go-to recipes.
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds medium shrimp - peeled, deveined, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces
1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil
Cook fettuccine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes
Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat and cook garlic until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes
Stir wine and tomato paste together in a small bowl; add to the saucepan
Simmer over low heat until sauce starts to thicken, about 10 minutes
Cook until shrimp are pink, 3 to 5 minutes
Remove about 2/3 of the shrimp with a slotted spoon and put in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until pureed
Return pureed shrimp to the saucepan and stir in heavy cream
